author: andschwa
body: PowerShell profiles have been enabled in HostUtilities and used by our custom host.   This will also allow us to fix #190  Config files in powershell usually reside in the Powershell directory, and are called 'powershell profiles'.  The environment variable $PROFILE in windows will lead you to your own PS Profile in windows.  Mine is located in   PS C  Users v zafolw> $PROFILE C  Users v zafolw Documents WindowsPowerShell Microsoft.PowerShell_profile.ps1  This might by blocked by CorePS, as they have  maybe  not yet implemented profiles.  *\* main.cs host could source this, and then add it to the list of commands scripts during startup, like it does with the prompt and the    expansion currently  Profiles in powershell are implemented in  monad src engine hostifaces HostUtilities.cs, which makes calls to Environment.SpecialFolder.Personal  an enum in Environment.cs, which relies on native Win32 calls.  The logic could be put in the Platform class inside CorePsPlatform inside Platform.NonWindowsGetFolderPath    a method to find special folders.
